intro: Oxychloe clandestina, commonly known as the hidden oxychloe, is a rare and elusive plant species found in specific microhabitats. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and inconspicuous flowers, which are typically pale green or white. The plant thrives in shaded, moist environments, often in rocky or forested areas. Its limited distribution and secretive nature make it a subject of interest for botanists. Due to habitat loss, Oxychloe clandestina is considered endangered in many regions.
